description: When 20-year-old Abbie Rutledge was pulled over for speeding two years ago by an Alabama state trooper, she had no idea how their conversation would change the trajectory of her life. Steve Hartman has their story in "On the Road."
title: Driver pulled over for speeding receives life-changing career advice

description: The NFL season kicked off with an electric opener between the Baltimore Ravens and Kansas City Chiefs Thursday night, but now attention shifts to the weekend. Thirteen matchups are set for Sunday, with six of them airing on CBS and Paramount Plus. CBS Sports HQ analyst Emory Hunt joins to discuss.
title: What to expect as NFL season kicks off

description: The case raises questions about how the person was exposed to the virus. All the previous U.S. infections were among people who worked around cows and poultry.
title: Missouri patient contracts bird flu despite no known contact with animals

description: Data from the National Institute of Health is showing a concerning rise in the number of breast cancer cases among Asian American and Pacific Islander women. Dr. Helen Chew, professor of medicine at UC Davis Health, joins to discuss.
title: Breast cancer cases rising among Asian American and Pacific Islander women

description: The U.S. added 142,000 jobs in August, the Labor Department reported Friday, which was below forecasts, although the unemployment rate ticked down to 4.2%.  Economists still overwhelmingly anticipate an interest rate cut from the Federal Reserve in mid-September. Jo Ling Kent has details.
title: Jobs report falls short of expectations with interest rate cuts likely looming

description: A New York judge on Friday ruled that former President Donald Trump will be sentenced Nov. 26, about three weeks after Election Day, for his conviction on charges of falsifying business records for payments to adult film star Stormy Daniels. Nikole Killion reports.
title: Sentencing delayed until after election in Trump "hush money" criminal case

description: An American woman who was protesting against Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank was fatally shot Friday, U.S. officials confirmed. Witnesses told CBS News that the woman, 26-year-old Aysenur Eygi, was shot by Israeli troops. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer spoke to people who were part of the protest when the shooting occurred.
title: U.S. protester fatally shot in West Bank

description: The father and son charged in the deadly Georgia school shooting have chosen not to seek bail and will remain in law enforcement custody. CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd joins with a weekly national security wrap-up.
title: Was the Georgia school shooting a preventable tragedy?

description: The world is struggling to manage growing piles of plastic waste, and a new report is bringing to light the problem of burning plastics. Annually, the world produces 440 million tons of plastic each year, but the majority of plastic is often tossed in the trash. CBS News senior national and environmental correspondent Ben Tracy has more.
title: Planet struggling to keep up with growing plastic pollution

description: Gen Z employees will outnumber Baby Boomers in the U.S. workforce by the end of this year, according to a Glassdoor report. Scott Dobroski, career trend expert for Indeed, joins to discuss.
title: Gen Z set to outnumber Baby Boomers in workforce

description: The Labor Department reported weaker-than-expected job growth for the month of August, adding 142,000 jobs. Meanwhile, the unemployment rate ticked down slightly to 4.2%. CBS News senior business and technology correspondent Jo Ling Kent has details.
title: August jobs report falls short of expectations

description: The State Department confirmed the death of an American citizen in the West Bank on Friday. Aysenur Eygi, 26, was killed during a protest against settlements. Israel Defense Forces said it was still investigating the incident, but confirmed its troops had opened fire in the area.
title: U.S. citizen killed in West Bank, officials say

description: The teenager accused of killing four people and injuring nine others in this week's mass shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia appeared in court Friday. CBS News national correspondent Dave Malkoff reports from Winder, Georgia, as the community mourns the victims.
title: Georgia shooting victims remembered as suspect faces judge

description: Pour 'em up in Yeti's new travel pitcher ideal for tailgate drinks to share.
title: Yeti's new Rambler pitcher is a tailgating essential

description: The judge overseeing former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal trial agreed Friday to postpone his sentencing until Nov. 26, which is after Election Day. CBS News legal contributor and Loyola Law School professor Jessica Levinson joins to discuss.
title: Will the election outcome impact Trump's sentencing?

description: Government data shows while there was an 18-month period with no U.S. troop deaths in Afghanistan, Trump was not in office for all of this time.
title: Truth behind Trump claims about U.S. troops deaths in Afghanistan

description: If you own a Nintendo Switch, there's plenty to look forward to for the rest of the year.
title: The best Nintendo Switch games coming in 2024 star familiar faces and friendly fun

description: Boeing's Starliner spacecraft departed the International Space Station on Friday just after 6 p.m., starting a journey back to Earth without any crew on board. The ship is expected to drop out of orbit and plunge to a landing at White Sands, New Mexico, just after midnight Eastern Time.
title: Boeing Starliner departs space station to return to Earth without a crew

description: Save up to 77% on furniture from some of our favorite home retailers, including Amazon, Wayfair and more.
title: Best Labor Day furniture sales to shop today

description: A CBS News investigation found more than a third of all top elections officials have quit or retired since the 2020 presidential election. Experts worry the inexperience of new supervisors could lead to mistakes.
title: Turnover among election officials is at its highest in at least two decades

description: Save big on older Apple products before it's time to embrace the new with the latest Apple Event.
title: The best Apple deals ahead of next week's big Apple event

description: Save money by making your favorite healthy juices at home with these highly rated juicers.

description: The fall Discover Samsung event kicks off September 9. Here's a preview of the amazing deals you can expect.

description: The best bed sheets on the market in 2024 are soft, durable and will make for a comfortable night's sleep.

description: Nearly 134,000 cases of multiple brands of apple juice are now being recalled because of of potential contamination.
title: Apple juice sold by Aldi and Walmart recalled due to arsenic concerns

description: A man accused of planning a terror attack at a New York City Jewish center was arrested in Canada, officials say.
title: Man accused of planning mass shooting at NYC Jewish center, authorities say

description: Mark Cuban, Barry Diller and James Murdoch among the prominent business world figures backing Kamala Harris' bid for the White House.

description: Nikki Haley tells CBS News' Margaret Brennan she doesn't agree with Trump's style, approach or communications, but she backs his policies.
title: Nikki Haley says she's "on standby" to campaign for Trump

description: Former U.S. ambassador to the U.N. Nikki Haley tells "Face The Nation" moderator Margaret Brennan that she doesn't agree with former President Donald Trump's campaign style or approach but supports him because of his policies. "For me, it's not a question," said Haley about voting for Trump over Vice President Kamala Harris in the 2024 election.
title: Nikki Haley on supporting Trump over Harris: "It's not a question"

description: Former U.S. ambassador to the U.N. Nikki Haley tells "Face The Nation" moderator Margaret Brennan that she is "on standby" to campaign for former President Donald Trump, adding that she will be "happy to be helpful" if he asks for her support or advice.
title: Nikki Haley says she's "on standby" to campaign for Trump

description: A baseless claim about Vice President Kamala Harris was published on a site masquerading as a legitimate news outlet this week. Experts say it's the latest in a series of sites created to dupe people.
title: Sham U.S. news site spreads false claims about Kamala Harris

description: Social Security Administration cited a "hardware issue" after it had to close offices and suspend personalized online services.
title: Social Security offices forced to close because of unspecified tech problem

description: The suspect in the Apalachee High School shooting and his father were arraigned Friday on charges connected to the attack. CBS News' Jericka Duncan has the latest from the court proceedings.
title: Inside the Georgia school shooting arraignments for father, son charged

description: Once the deal is finalized, the seafood chain will operate under a new CEO — Damola Adamolekun, former chief executive of P.F. Chang's.
title: Red Lobster to claw its way back from bankruptcy after judge approves sale

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said "it is a critical moment" in the war against Russia as news of more U.S. aid emerges. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata has the latest.
title: Zelenskyy on critical moment in war against Russia

description: If you've been waiting to list your home for sale, it could make sense to make your move now. Here's why.
title: Should you sell your home this September?

description: The costs for a $500,000 mortgage loan are manageable now and could become cheaper in the weeks and months ahead.
title: How much will a $500,000 mortgage cost per month after rates are cut?

description: Dick Cheney was vice president under former President George W. Bush.
title: Liz Cheney says Dick Cheney will vote for Kamala Harris

description: Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders says he sees the food industry that makes processed foods akin to the tobacco industry, stipulating there needs to be more oversight on ultra-processed foods being sold to Americans. CBS News' Adam Yamaguchi reports for "Ultra Processed: How Food Tech Consumed the American Diet."
title: Bernie Sanders compares processed food industry to tobacco industry

description: A teenager is in serious condition after a shooting inside Joppatowne High School Friday afternoon.
title: Teen in serious condition after shooting inside Joppatowne High School

description: Israel's military has pulled out from Jenin, a city and Palestinian refugee camp in the occupied West Bank. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has more.
title: Israel West Bank operations. What we know.

description: Investors are fretting about economic growth, with tech stocks taking the brunt after an underwhelming jobs report.
title: S&P 500 heading for its worst week since March 2023

description: The Harris-Walz campaign said Vice President Kamala Harris raised $361 million in August while Former President Donald Trump brought in $130 million, according to his campaign. CBS News' Nikole Killion and Aaron Navarro report.
title: Harris campaign nearly triples Trump fundraising numbers in August

description: Trump attends New York court hearing to appeal verdict in E. Jean Carroll case; Top New York City officials raided in investigation.
title: 9/6: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: The August jobs report released Friday indicated fewer new positions than economists forecasted. The stock market is reacting to the news as a potential September interest rate cut is still expected. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger has more.
title: Jobs report impacts stocks as possible interest rate cut looms

description: Caleb Williams is taking Chicago by storm. Find out when to watch the 2024 No. 1 overall NFL Draft pick play.
title: Will Caleb Williams play today? How to watch Chicago Bears games

description: The Apalachee High School shooting suspect and his father were arraigned Friday. Colin Gray, the 14-year-old's father, was charged with several counts, including involuntary manslaughter and second-degree murder, the Georgia Bureau of Investigation announced. CBS News' Anna Schecter has the latest news.
title: Latest news on Georgia high school shooting, father and son arraigned

description: A nationwide listeria outbreak blamed for nine deaths is turning into a potential legal nightmare for food maker Boar's Head.

description: Judge Juan Merchan has delayed sentencing in former President Donald Trump's New York "hush money" criminal trial to occur after the 2024 presidential election against Vice President Kamala Harris. CBS News' Graham Kates and Katrina Kaufman have the latest.
title: Judge in Trump New York criminal case pushes sentencing past 2024 election

description: Want to get organized for fall? Clean up on space-saving vacuum storage bags with this deal at Amazon.

title: Apple is set to unveil new iPhone 16 Monday. Here's what to expect.

description: Trump was convicted in May on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in relation to a "hush money" payment  to an adult film star before the 2016 election.
title: Judge delays sentencing in Trump's N.Y. criminal case until after election

description: While NASA doesn't trust the Starliner to carry its crew back to Earth, Boeing is confident the ship will land successfully in New Mexico.

description: The Buccaneers' first-ever coaching academy is already making an impact, helping Genevieve Humphrey ease into a new position in the NFL.

description: Republican Cameron Quinn used to run elections in Virginia and locally in Fairfax County, Virginia. She explained change and new blood in elections offices can sometimes be a good thing.
title: Managing the Vote: Extended interview with Cameron Quinn

description: Democrat Dana DeBeauvoir ran local elections in Texas for 36 years. She believes transparency from officials who run elections can lead to increased voter confidence.
title: Managing the Vote: Extended interview with Dana DeBeauvoir

description: Edward "Eddie" Perez researches voting technology and how elections are administered with the nonpartisan OSET Institute. He told CBS News an "unprecedented number of elections officials are leaving the profession, a trend that has greatly accelerated over the last few years.
title: Managing the Vote: Extended interview with Edward "Eddie" Perez

description: Watch every New England Patriots game in the 2024-2025, even if you don't have cable.
title: How to watch every New England Patriots game in the 2024-2025 NFL season

description: Prosecutors initially had said Geas used a lock attached to a belt to repeatedly hit the 89-year-old Bulger in the head.
title: Hitman who killed Whitey Bulger sentenced to 25 years in prison

description: The Grammy-winning musician's composition "Mas Que Nada" was one of the songs that helped popularize the Brazilian music genre bossa nova worldwide in the 1960s.
title: Sergio Mendes, Brazilian bossa nova legend, dies at 83

description: The budget-friendly GoPro Hero camera is loaded with features and is now available for preorder.
title: This new GoPro Hero camera is under $200. Pre-order it now

description: Aging at home is the goal for many seniors and older adults. But how can they afford to do so? Here's what to know.
title: How seniors can afford to age at home

description: Donald Trump said Thursday that if elected, he would want Elon Musk to lead a government efficiency commission that Musk has been pushing. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has more.
title: Trump says he wants Elon Musk to lead proposed government efficiency commission

description: James and Jennifer Crumbley were held responsible for their roles in the Oxford High School shooting that killed four students.
title: Charges against Georgia school shooter's dad echo Crumbley case

description: Rebecca Cheptegei died Thursday at a Kenyan hospital where she was being treated after 80% of her body was burned in the attack. She was 33.
title: Paris wants to name venue after murdered Olympian

description: Cleveland, Ohio-based steel producer applauds reports that takeover of U.S. Steel by Japan's Nippon Steel will be blocked.
title: Cleveland-Cliffs reiterates offer to buy mills under closure threat by U.S. Steel

description: A watchdog agency in the U.K. is launching an investigation into the way more than 1 million tickets were sold for Oasis' reunion tour happening next year in the U.K. and Ireland. Fans waited in hours-long virtual lines and many say they ended up paying more than double the advertised price.
title: Ticketmaster faces new scrutiny in U.K. over Oasis concert tickets

description: The Department of Transportation is investigating frequent flyer and credit card rewards programs at American Airlines, Delta Airlines, United Airlines and Southwest Airlines. The probe is looking into how consumers could be impacted by extra fees, hidden pricing or earned rewards losing their value.
title: Feds investigate frequent flyer programs at four major airlines

description: In this installment of the series, "Note to Self," journalist Jenisha Watts opens up about her turbulent upbringing. Reflecting on her past, she writes a letter to her younger self about overcoming drug addiction and neglect, and how revealing her hidden story set her free.
title: Note to Self: Magazine editor Jenisha Watts shares journey of truth and resilience

description: Federal investigators have raided the homes and seized the phones of NYPD commissioner Edward A. Caban and some of New York City Mayor Eric Adams' top aides, including Deputy Mayor Sheena Wright and schools chancellor David Banks. CBS New York reporter Elijah Westbrook has the latest.
title: Feds raid homes of NYPD commissioner, NYC Mayor Eric Adams' top aides

description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers launched a groundbreaking coaching academy to increase diversity on the sidelines. CBS Sports' Jonathan Jones introduces us to one of the program's participants who is now living her dream as an NFL coach.
title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers coaching academy breaks barriers, promotes diversity within NFL staffs

description: Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman to serve as a Supreme Court justice​, opened up about how she and her husband Patrick Jackson met and navigated their interracial relationship.
title: Ketanji Brown Jackson shares her and husband's love story

description: The journalist and author of the bestseller "America's Bitter Pill" writes how misinformation and conspiracy theories, spread via social media, destroy the common thread of facts and shared truths that holds a democracy together.
title: Book excerpt: "The Death of Truth" by Steven Brill

description: The suspected gunman accused of killing four people earlier this week at a Georgia high school was arraigned along with his father Friday morning. CBS News national correspondent Jericka Duncan has more.
title: Alleged Georgia school shooter and father arraigned

description: CBS News Climate Correspondent David Schechter explores cooling solutions to stay healthy and safe as climate change makes our planet hotter.
title: Climate Watch: Overheated

description: A hearing was held Friday in New York over former President Donald Trump's appeal of the judgment in the E. Jean Carroll sexual abuse case. CBS News investigative reporter Graham Kates has more.
title: Court hears argument in Trump appeal of E. Jean Carroll verdict

description: Both options have attractive features for borrowers this fall. Here's how to determine which is best for you.
title: Personal loans vs. home equity loans: Which is better now?

description: American Jessica Pegula and Belarusian Aryna Sabalenka will face off in the U.S. Open women's singles final Saturday. Pegula made a 3-set comeback against former top-10 Czech player Karolina Muchova to reach the final round. The Athletic tennis writer Charlie Eccleshare joins CBS News to break it down.
title: What to expect from the U.S. Open women's final

description: The average temperature from June to August was 104.5 degrees, breaking previous records of 104.2 degrees, set in 2021 and 2018.
title: Death Valley National Park just had its hottest summer on record

description: North Carolina sent out their mail-in absentee ballots today, the first in the nation to do so. CBS News political contributor Joel Payne and CBS News political analyst Leslie Sanchez discuss what this could mean for the Harris and Trump campaigns.
title: First 2024 U.S. election ballots mailed out in North Carolina

description: Palestinian media is reporting that an American woman who was participating in an anti-settler protest in the West Bank was shot and killed by Israeli forces. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has more.
title: American reportedly killed in West Bank by Israeli forces

description: Facebook posts that contained the phrase — often used to show support for Palestinians — didn't violate Meta's rules, panel says.
title: Meta board says "from the river to the sea" isn't always hate speech

description: Kamala Harris' running mate, Tim Walz, is being summoned to stand before a Republican-led House committee investigating a Minnesota-based nonprofit that's accused of diverting federal funds meant to feed low-income families during the COVID-19 pandemic. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has the latest on that and new fundraising numbers from the Harris campaign.
title: Walz subpoenaed in House GOP investigation into Minnesota nonprofit's use of COVID-19 funds

description: People in the small city of Winder, Georgia, are mourning the deaths of four people killed Wednesday at Apalachee High School. Police say a 14-year-old student shot them and wounded nine others. He's now in custody. The four who were killed were two students and two teachers. Here's what we know so far about them.
title: Who were the Georgia high school shooting victims?

description: Savers should consider multiple options for maximizing their returns this September. Here's what to do.
title: 4 smart savings moves to make this September

description: The father of the accused shooter who allegedly killed four people at a Georgia high school earlier this week appeared in court Friday morning. He's been charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter, two counts of second-degree murder and eight counts of cruelty to children
title: Father of suspected Georgia school shooter makes first court appearance

description: The August unemployment report is in, and it could have major consequences for interest rate policy. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger breaks down the key takeaways and what they mean for the economy.
title: August unemployment report released: What it means for interest rates

description: The U.S. added 142,000 jobs in August, slightly below economists' expectations while unemployment decreased from 4.3% to 4.2%. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger has more on what that means for the Federal Reserve's upcoming decision on interest rates.
title: Fed likely to cut interest rates as U.S. adds 142,000 jobs in August, slightly fewer than expected

description: Students and community members are sharing their memories of the victims who died in the school shooting in Georgia as people on Thursday gathered and laid flowers outside of the school. One student told CBS News that one of the victims, math teacher Cristina Irime, took a bullet that could have hit another child.
title: Community remembers Georgia school shooting victims

description: Bestselling author Elin Hilderbrand, known for her summer novels set in Nantucket, celebrates the debut of her first TV series adaptation. "The Perfect Couple," now on Netflix, stars Nicole Kidman and Liev Schreiber in a thrilling mystery that unfolds when a body is discovered during a wedding celebration.
title: Author Elin Hilderbrand talks TV adaptation of "The Perfect Couple"

description: NASA has decided to fly Boeing's Starliner spacecraft back from the International Space Station without astronauts due to safety concerns. The spacecraft is expected to land in New Mexico just after midnight, weather permitting, marking another setback in the troubled multi-billion-dollar program.
title: Boeing's Starliner returning to Earth without passengers amid safety concerns

description: A growing group of evangelical Christians is hoping to make a major impact in the 2024 presidential election and elect former President Donald Trump. The group's leader told CBS News' Major Garrett he views Trump as a once-in-a-thousand years figure: flawed, but divinely chosen to navigate chaotic times.
title: Evangelical Christian leader mobilizes followers in hopes of making a big impact in election

description: The shooting at a high school in Georgia has highlighted the issue of gun control in the tight presidential race. Both candidates recently have also put a focus on their economic plans, outlining their differences. On Friday, former President Donald Trump will head to North Carolina, a potential swing state, while Vice President Kamala Harris prepares for the upcoming debate.
title: Trump, Harris campaigns address gun control, economic plans

description: The father of the Georgia school shooting suspect is under arrest. Also, Hunter Biden enters a surprise guilty plea to federal tax evasion charges. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Father of Georgia school shooting suspect arrested

description: The Philadelphia Eagles and Green Bay Packers will open their seasons Friday night with a game in São Paulo, Brazil, the NFL's first regular season matchup in South America. Jay Busbee, senior writer for Yahoo! Sports, joined CBS News to talk about that game and some of the league's other opening weekend games.
title: Eagles and Packers to play in NFL's first South American regular season game

description: Doctors in the Israeli-occupied West Bank say American national Aysenur Eygi was fatally shot at a pro-Palestinian demonstration.
title: American woman killed at protest in Israeli-occupied West Bank

description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has announced an additional $250 million in security assistance for Ukraine as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy presses his allies for more weapons. The news comes as Russia continues its onslaught on Ukraine with another wave of missile and drone attacks overnight. Senior national security correspondent Charlie D'Agata has more.
title: U.S. to send additional $250 million to Ukraine as Russia launches more attacks

description: The suspected gunman who allegedly killed two students and two teachers at a Georgia high school earlier this week made his first court appearance Friday. Anna Schecter, CBS News crime and public safety unit senior coordinating producer, has more on the case.
title: Georgia school shooting suspect makes first court appearance

description: Former ballerina Ashley Benefield is awaiting sentencing after being convicted of manslaughter in the shooting death of her estranged husband Doug Benefield in September 2020. CBS News' Jim Axelrod reports on the new details emerging from the so-called "Black Swan" murder trial, where Benefield testified about their relationship and the night Doug was killed in an all-new "48 Hours."
title: "48 Hours" reviews gripping testimony in "Black Swan" murder trial

description: Kamala Harris' campaign reports it raised $361 million in August, bringing her total cash on hand to $404 million. Harris' camp notes many of the donations were from first-time donors and more than 60% of donors in August were women. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Kamala Harris' campaign raises $361 million for August

description: The latest labor market data comes less than two weeks ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision on whether to cut interest rates.
title: Employers added 142,000 jobs in August, weaker than forecasted

description: Hunter Biden pleaded guilty to nine federal charges on Thursday in his tax evasion case in Los Angeles, admitting he failed to pay more than $1 million in taxes.
title: Hunter Biden pleads guilty to 9 federal charges in tax evasion case

description: A New York judge is expected to announce when former President Donald Trump will be sentenced in his "hush money" criminal case. The former president was convicted on 34 counts of falsifying business records and could face sentencing as early as September 18th after pushing for a delay several times. CBS News campaign reporter Hunter Woodall has more.
title: Judge expected to announce Trump sentencing date in NYC "hush money" case

description: Authorities arrested Colin Gray, the alleged Georgia school shooter's father, on Thursday. He faces a series of charges, including second-degree murder. Investigators say the AR-style rifle used in the shooting was purchased by the suspect's father as a gift last December.
title: Father of alleged gunman in Georgia school shooting arrested

description: Lloyd Austin announces more support for Ukraine at a "critical moment" in the war with Russia, as Zelenskyy says his partners' promises are unfulfilled.
title: U.S. promises Ukraine more aid at "critical moment" in war with Russia

description: At least 17 students are dead and 13 others are injured after a fire erupted in an elementary school dorm in Kenya. Police say the fire engulfed rooms where children were sleeping with the victims believed to be between the ages of 9 and 13. The cause of the fire is being investigated. Anne Soy, BBC News senior correspondent and deputy Africa editor, joined CBS News with more on the fire.
title: At least 17 students killed in Kenya school fire

description: Fifth grader Karin Tabira passed a test that means she is now certified to slice and gut the poisonous fish for consumption.
title: Girl, 10, becomes youngest person certified to prepare poisonous fish

description: A federal judge probed the terms of a proposed $2.78 billion settlement of antitrust lawsuits against the NCAA and major conferences and revealed a potential snag in the deal involving student-athlete payments.
title: Possible snag in landmark deal with NCAA over student-athletes payments

description: Catch Saquon Barkley and the Philadelphia Eagles play the Green Bay Packers live from Brazil tonight in NFL Week 1.
title: How to watch the Packers vs. Eagles NFL game tonight

description: Catch Saquon Barkley and the Philadelphia Eagles play the Green Bay Packers live from Brazil tonight in NFL Week 1.
title: How to watch the Packers vs. Eagles NFL game tonight

description: There were three loaded guns in her house the night former ballerina Ashley Benefield shot and killed her estranged husband Doug Benefield.
title: "Black Swan" defendant had a gun in her bra the night she met her husband

description: Attorneys for former President Donald Trump will argue that a $5 million judgment finding him liable for sexually abusing and defaming E. Jean Carroll should be thrown out.
title: Trump lawyers to ask court to toss judgment in E. Jean Carroll case

description: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada, co-founder of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, was arrested along with Joaquín Guzmán López after landing at an airport near El Paso in July.
title: Top Mexico cartel leader agrees to be transferred to New York

description: The men's and women's singles draw champions will take home 20% more than they did last year, out of record $75 million pot.
title: How much prize money do U.S. Open winners get?

description: The secretive National Security Agency recounts its contributions to the decade-long search for 9/11 mastermind Osama bin Laden in the launch of its new podcast, "No Such Podcast."
title: National Security Agency reveals details of its role in hunt for bin Laden

description: The IRS said funding from the Inflation Reduction Act has helped it go after wealthy taxpayers who failed to pay their tax bills.
title: IRS has recovered $1.3 billion in unpaid taxes from rich Americans

description: A fire in a school dormitory in central Kenya killed 17 students and seriously burned 13 others, police said.
title: Fire in school dorm in Kenya kills at least 17 students, police say

description: Former President Donald Trump has twice sought to delay sentencing after his conviction in May by a unanimous jury on 34 felony counts of falsifying business records.
title: Decision on Trump sentencing date in "hush money" case likely coming Friday

description: ChiefsAholic, a fan who dressed in a wolf costume to attend Chiefs games, was sentenced on charges related to bank robberies across seven states.
title: Chiefs fan "ChiefsAholic" sentenced to over 17 years for bank robberies

description: Rich Homie Quan was one of the biggest names in hip-hop in the mid-2010s.
title: Rich Homie Quan, Atlanta rapper known for trap jams, dies at 33

description: The Justice Department on Thursday charged five Russian military members with an alleged cyberattack conspiracy in 2022 that targeted Ukraine and 26 NATO allies, including the United States. It comes a day after the U.S. accused Russia of attempting to interfere in the 2024 election. CBS News cybersecurity expert Chris Krebs joins to discuss.
title: U.S. expands indictments in Russia cyberattacks

description: Authorities are investigating if the teen suspected in the Apalachee High School shooting in Winder, Georgia, received the AR-style rifle as a gift from his father, law enforcement sources told CBS News.
title: Where the suspected Georgia school shooter got the gun

description: Two students and two teachers were killed when a 14-year-old student opened fire in Apalachee High School in Georgia Tuesday. They were identified as Richard Aspinwall, Christina Irimie, Mason Schermerhorn and Christian Angulo. Jericka Duncan has more on who they were.
title: What we know about the victims of the Georgia school shooting

description: Lawyers were back in a D.C. court Thursday to discuss the conspiracy and obstruction case charging Donald Trump with interfering with the 2020 election. It was the first hearing since the Supreme Court ruled former and current presidents have immunity from criminal prosecution for "official acts" taken in office. CBS News campaign reporter and attorney Katrina Kaufman has more.
title: What comes next for Trump election interference case

description: Jury selection was set to start Thursday in the second trial this year for Hunter Biden -- this time for federal tax evasion. But the president's son requested to change his plea several times over the course of the day, eventually entering a guilty plea. CBS News legal contributor and Loyola Law School professor Jessica Levinson joins to discuss the whirlwind day in court.
title: Why Hunter Biden suddenly switched to a guilty plea before his trial

description: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson recently sat down with CBS News for her first broadcast interview since joining the Supreme Court in 2022. "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell discussed several topics with her, including affirmative action, which the nation's highest court struck down back in June of last year.
title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson discusses affirmative action

description: Yet another former prominent conservative is joining the effort to elect Kamala Harris. Former chair of the House Republican Conference Liz Cheney lost her 2022 primary after expressing outrage over former President Donald Trump's actions on Jan. 6, 2021, and has remained a vocal critic of Trump since then. Semafor politics reporter Shelby Talcott and NOTUS politics reporter Jasmine Wright join to discuss.
title: Liz Cheney joins Republicans backing Harris for President

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are hitting each other hard on the economy. CBS News polling finds that's the top issue for voters in the 2024 election. Democratic strategist James Carville joins to discuss what's at stake.
title: Trump and Harris criticize each other on economy

description: Discover all of the new features added to the GoPro Hero 13 Black action camera that's now available for preorder.
title: Preorder the GoPro Hero 13 Black, which is full of fresh features

description: Discover all of the new features added to the GoPro Hero 13 Black action camera that's now available for preorder.
title: Preorder the GoPro Hero 13 Black, which is full of fresh features

description: In this episode of "Person to Person,” “CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell conducted the first television interview with Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson since she was confirmed to the high court.
title: Person to Person: Norah O'Donnell interviews Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson

description: A former ballerina shoots her husband. Did she kill to save herself or was it out of spite? Contributor Jim Axelrod reports in a special two-part "48 Hours" airing Saturday, Sept. 7 from 9-11 p.m. ET/PT on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
title: Sneak peek: The Case of the Black Swan (Part 1)

description: President Biden is set to block the nearly $15 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel by Japan's Nippon Steel. Hundreds of U.S. Steel workers have rallied in Pittsburgh in support of the deal, and the CEO has warned if it collapses, the company may leave the city and take thousands of jobs with it. Mayor Chris Kelly of West Mifflin, Pennsylvania, joins to discuss the potential consequences.
title: Some concerned collapse of U.S. Steel deal will hurt workers

description: Authorities held a news conference on Thursday to address the arrest of Colin Gray, the father of the Georgia school shooting suspect, and give an update on the investigation. The charges against the 54-year-old father stem from him "knowingly allowing" his son to possess a weapon, Georgia Bureau of Investigation Director Chris Hosey said.
title: Authorities give details on arrest of Georgia school shooting suspect's father

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is headed to Pennsylvania to prepare for next week's debate against former President Donald Trump. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Harris in Pennsylvania to prep for debate

description: Law enforcement officers in Winder, Georgia, were able to rapidly respond to Wednesday's shooting at Apalachee High School because of new technology. Barrow County Sheriff Jud Smith says the district had given all teachers special new ID badges armed with panic buttons just one week ago. Abbey Clements, a teacher who co-founded Teachers Unify to End Gun Violence after surviving the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School massacre, joins to discuss what educators are up against.
title: Sandy Hook shooting survivor discusses what teachers face

description: As new details emerge about what may have led to the shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, students are still reeling from the tragedy. One survivor describes her experience while tearfully mourning the loss of her classmate.
title: Georgia shooting survivor mourns classmate: "He was a sweet kid"

description: For decades, the epidemic of school shootings seems to be something the U.S. has been unable to change. Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, became the site of the latest such tragedy, where four people were killed Wednesday. Jim Axelrod examines how school shootings seem to be a problem with no solution.
title: How the school shooting epidemic still grips the U.S.

description: Rep your favorite football team with one of Yeti's NFL-themed products.
title: NFL Yeti drinkware and coolers just dropped

description: Many portions of the Southwest are contending with triple-digit temperatures this week. Phoenix has had three straight months of 100-degree temperatures, while in the Los Angeles area, search and rescue teams this year have conducted hundreds of rescues of hikers due to heat illness. Carter Evans reports.
title: Scorching heat intensifies across the West
